message:
Charge framing against Quasem 18 July

The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) Thursday fixed 18 July as the date for framing charges against Jamaat-e-Islami executive committee member and Diganta Media Corporation Chairman Mir Quasem Ali.
 
The tribunal led by ICT-1 Chairman Justice ATM Fazle Kabir issued the order Thursday.
 
Ali, who is now under detention, faces war crimes charges that he allegedly committed during the liberation war in 1971.
 
The tribunal on 26 May accepted charges against Ali and said the hearing on framing charges against Ali would be held on 27 June.
 
The tribunal also asked the defence team to submit relevant documents on 27 June.
 
Defence lawyer advocate Mizanul Islam Thursday said the 109-page document submitted by the prosecution was fuzzy and thereafter sought an eight-week extention with regard to the previously-scheduled hearing.
 
Prosecutor Zeyad Al Masum, however, spoke against the extention and opined that the defense should get only a seven-day extention.
 
The tribunal, following completion of hearings of both sides, granted a three-week extension.
